result.execSummary:
Steven Lee Olson was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Steven Lee Olson was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Extradition paperwork mailed to Gov Walker

2:36  Steven Lee Olson in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson who appears by telephone.  Defendant Steven Lee Olson in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has copy of complaint address is correct. Defendant signs the waiver of extradition. Judge orally acknowleges that the defendant has signed the extradition waiver. Clerk will fax to Judge for his signature
